factText: More than 4,900 structures are now being threatened by the blaze, which grew to 7,500 acres Thursday and was 5 percent contained, according to the U.S. Forest Service- San Bernardino National Forest. The blaze is expected to keep growing through Friday, especially in the wilderness and the Rattlesnake Spring areas, according to Chad Cook, operations section chief with the California Incident Manag. The Carr Fire is threatening areas west of Redding as it expands to 20,000 acres, Cal Fire said.

factText: SMOKE ADVISORY: The #CranstonFire has caused a smoke advisory to be issued, stating that southwesterly winds, blowing 10 to 15 mph in some places, are likely to spread smoke over a wide area. Scorching heat, winds and dry conditions complicated firefighting efforts.
